content:
Amy Klobuchar becomes the 15th declared candidate in a wide-open primary race

bore down on Minneapolis on February 10th, Amy Klobuchar, a senator from Minnesota, announced before a shivering crowd that she would run for president. Covered in snow, Ms Klobuchar promised to bring her “grit” to Washington to fight for every “worker, farmer, dreamer and builder”. Ms Klobuchar becomes the biggest name in the race who does not hail from a coastal state. Prognosticators have latched onto this as an argument for her strong electability. However, it is far too early to make bold predictions about who is likely to clinch the nomination. Polls fielded at this stage of the race are extremely unreliable at predicting the eventual winner, and even the crowd wisdom provided by betting markets is highly volatile.

There already seems to be a Democrat for everyone in 2020, and not all of the likely candidates have declared. But according to

’s analysis of polling in party nominations between 1980 and 2016, this early in a cycle just 17% of polls released have correctly identified the eventual party nominee. In February 2007, for example, Hillary Clinton had a 20-point lead over a young Barack Obama, who would end up winning the nomination a year and a half later in one of the closest primaries in recent memory. On the Republican side, Donald Trump had not even announced his candidacy 72 weeks before his party’s convention in 2016.

There are other ways to gauge who is ahead. Betting markets provide an opportunity for prognosticators to put real money behind their arguments, and performed admirably in predicting the 2018 midterms. According to the latest numbers from predictIt, a popular American market, Kamala Harris has opened up a meaningful lead against all of the other currently announced candidates. However, with Joe Biden, the former Vice President, and Beto O’Rourke, who did surprisingly well in his Texas Senate race last year, not far behind, her position may deteriorate if they actually declare. In the game of presidential primaries, it is simply too early to say who might find a ladder and who will stumble upon a chute.

Picture credits: AP; EPA; Reuters

eg2: Because of the decentralization of power, however, the United States admirably fulfills the gold standard of pluralist democracy, which assumes multiple centers of power.
然而，由于权力分散，美国非常好地满足了应有多个权力中心的多元主义民主政治的黄金标准。
"We're very aware of what's going on in the world but we have to trade that off with being fair to our people who, we believe, have performed admirably throughout this crisis, " said Viniar.
“我们非常清楚这个世界正在发生什么，但是为了公正对待我们的员工，我们必须把那些事情放在一边；我们相信，员工们在危机中的表现令人钦佩。” 温尼亚尔说。
If one ambition of journalism is to help us understand and imagine places we have not seen, both of these fulfill that role .
新闻工作追求的是帮助人们理解和猜象我们不能看见的地方，两方面都巧妙地担当了这一角色。

eg2: Maybe that’s why we save those for the ones  to us, like our families.
也许这就是为什么我们保存那些与我们最亲近的东西，例如家庭。
A. Some of my closest friends in the world are still doing this work — not just in Chicago but elsewhere.
这个世界上一些我最要好的朋友还在做这样的工作——不仅仅是在芝加哥，世界各地都有。
To varyingdegrees, we all have secrets which we do not want evenour  friends to learn, but few of us have skeletons in the cupboard.
我们在不同程度上艘有一些甚至连最亲密的朋友也不想让他们知道的秘密，但是却极少有人有橱中骷髅。

ex: vi. 恶化，变坏
vt. 恶化
eg2: Her findings have helped to transform conventional ideas about how the brain starts to deteriorate once we reach our teenage years.
她的发现有助于转变我们通常的观念——一旦渡过青少年时期之后，我们的大脑便开始走向恶化。
“The goal is to do a scan on someone before they get the disease and be able to tell if they’re at higher risk or starting to , ” she said.
“我们的目标是在某人患上老年痴呆病之前， 对他的脑部进行扫描，从而预先告知他们是否处于较高疾病风险或情况开始恶化，”她说。
We know that a form of selection occurs within our brains as we develop and learn - synaptic connections and pathways that work well are reinforced, whereas weak ones .
我们知道，人在发育和学习期间大脑里面发生一种形式的选择——那些运转正常的突触链接和路径得到加强，而弱者恶化。

ex: adj. 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的

wp.eventual consistency: 最终一致性;最终一致;一致性

eg2: What does all this mean for eventual control of the stricken reactor as well as the cleanup?
所有的这些对最终控制瘫痪的反应堆和清除核废物意味着什么？
Combined with reduced blood flow, neuropathy in the feet increases the chance of foot ulcers and  limb amputation.
足部神经病与血流量减少结合在一起，增加了患足部溃疡的可能，最终导致截肢。

ex: n. 勇气；沙砾；毅力；沙粒
v. （在结冰的路上）撒沙砾

eg2: I had a piece of grit in my eye.
我眼睛里进了一粒沙子。
They were spreading grit and salt on the icy roads.
他们在结冰的路上撒沙子和盐。
She gritted her teeth against the pain.
她咬牙忍痛。
‘Stop it!’ he said through gritted teeth.
“住手！”他咬牙切齿地说。
It started to rain harder, but we gritted our teeth and carried on.
雨开始大起来，可我们鼓起勇气继续进行。
She gritted her teeth against the pain.
她咬牙忍痛。
‘Stop it!’ he said through gritted teeth.

It started to rain harder, but we gritted our teeth and carried on.

ex: n. 冰雹；雹子；【气】雹；像雹子般落下的东西

eg2: The conference was hailed as a great success.

It's hailing!
正下着冰雹！

我们顶着冰雹和大雪开车。

a hail of abuse

ex: n. 门闩；锁存；插销；卡齿

eg2: He lifted the latch and opened the door.
他拉起门闩开了门。
She listened for his key in the latch.
她留神听着他把钥匙插入门锁。
Can you leave the door on the latch so I can get in?
你别锁门好不好？我好进来。
Can you leave the door on the latch so I can get in?

wp.Midterm election: 中期选举;期中选举;中期推举

eg2: PROF: Yes This is the indirect method but on the  it was the direct method STUDENT: But I am saying maintaining the order is important right?
教授：是的,这是间接法,但是关于期中考试,那是直接法,学生：但是我说,保持顺序很重要,对不对？
The war in Iraq was a predominant issue in the 2006 midterm elections, and Newport said it appears that it will continue to be the dominant issue during the next year.
在2006年的中期选举期间，伊拉克战争是占主导地位的问题。 纽波特说，看来这个问题在明年的选举中将继续成为压倒一切的问题。
The politically good news for Obama is that no matter what the outcome of the midterm elections, everything changes in January.
任何事情都将在一月份改变，不论中期选举是什么结果，这对奥巴马来说都是利好的消息。

wp.nomination process: 提名程序;提名过程;提名方式

eg2: This is her first Oscar .
这是她的首次奥斯卡提名。
He instructed his staff to crank up for an all-out fight against the .
他指示手下工作人员做好准备，全力以赴反对这项提名。
She was nominated for an appeals court judgeship in 1999. But the Senate never voted on her .
虽然她在1999年被提名为上诉法院法官，但是参议院从未就她的提名投票。

wp.common nominee: 共用代理人;共享代理人

ex: n. 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人
eg2: I think the president will ask any  to discuss how they view the Constitution and the legal principles enshrined in it.
我认为总统将会和所有的被提名人讨论他们如何看待宪法和已载入的法律原则。
The president did not formally endorse McCain, but did say he was willing to campaign on behalf of the eventual Republican .
布什总统没有正式表态支持麦凯恩，但是他说，他愿意为最后将赢得共和党提名的侯选人竞选。
This process can be contentious, especially in cases in which committee members are trying to gauge a ’s views on a controversial issue.
这一过程可能会有争议，特别是在国会相关委员会成员想在有争议问题上判断被提名人的观点的情况下。

ex: n. 预报；预言

wp.earthquake prediction: 地震预测;		地震预报;地震预告;地震猜测
wp.motion prediction: 运动预测;航迹预算学;运动预报
wp.numerical prediction: 数值预测;数值预估;数值预报;数值推测
wp.prediction theory: 预报理论;		预测理论

eg2: Without experience, you have no basis for any .
由于经验的缺乏，你的预言就缺乏根基。
I’ll explain below how this interpolation and prediction works, but first let me show you why it is needed.
下面我会阐明插值与预报是怎样工作的，但首先让我说明下为什么需要这些。
There was no prediction for this earthquake, and therefore no warning. Hope in the accurate predictability of earthquakes evaporated.
因为这场地震没有任何预报，因此也没有警告，想要准确预测地震的希望成为泡影。

ex: adj. 总统的；首长的；统辖的

wp.presidential government: 总统制;总统制政府;总统制政体

eg2: This scandal is bound to tell against him in the coming presidential election.
在即将到来的总统竞选中这一丑闻必然对他不利。

eg2: The senator declaimed against the opposition.
这名参议员猛烈抨击反对派。
Rumours of corruption dishonoured the .
有关腐化的谣传使该参议员丧失了名誉。
Her husband is a lobbyist, and familiar with almost every .
她的丈夫是位说客， 几乎跟每位参议员都熟。

ex: n. 颤抖；寒战
v. 颤抖
网络 发抖；打颤；战栗
eg2: Don't stand outside shivering─come inside and get warm!
别站在外面冻得打哆嗦了，进来暖暖身子吧！
He shivered at the thought of the cold, dark sea.
那寒冷黑暗的大海，他想想都吓得发抖。
to shiver with cold/excitement/pleasure, etc.
冷得发抖、激动得发抖、高兴得发抖等
The sound of his voice sent shivers down her spine .
一听见他的说话声，她就背上一阵阵发冷。
He felt a cold shiver of fear run through him.
他吓得打了一个寒战。
I don't like him. He gives me the shivers .
我不喜欢他，一见他我就不寒而栗。
Symptoms include headaches, vomiting and the shivers.
症状包括头痛、呕吐和打寒噤。

ex: n. 绊倒；失足；失误；失败
v. 绊脚；跌跌撞撞地走；蹒跚而行；演奏
网络 犯错误；跌倒；绊跌
eg2: The child stumbled and fell.
孩子绊了一下，摔倒了。
I stumbled over a rock.
我在石头上绊了一下。
We were stumbling around in the dark looking for a candle.
黑暗中，我们东跌西撞地找蜡烛。
In her nervousness she stumbled over her words.
她因紧张说话结结巴巴的。
I stumbled through the piano piece with difficulty.
我断断续续地好不容易弹完了那支钢琴曲。

ex: adj. 不可靠的；靠不住的

wp.unreliable narrator: 不可靠的叙述者;不可靠叙述者;不可靠的叙事者;不可信的叙述者

eg2: That’s twice what the unreliable rumor says.
这是那些不可靠的流言所说的两倍。
They are two of a kind and totally .
他俩是同类货色， 都是不可靠的人。
If they sided with their Muslim friends, they were regarded as . In spite of their Muslim faith, they were after all Chinese!
如果他们站在穆斯林朋友一边，会被认为不可靠，因为尽管他们有穆斯林信仰，他们仍然是汉人。

ex: adj. 易变的；无定性的；无常性的；可能急剧波动的
网络 挥发性；挥发性的；不稳定的
eg2: a highly volatile personality
反复无常的个性
a highly volatile situation from which riots might develop
可能会出现动乱的极不稳定的局势
a volatile exchange rate
剧烈波动的汇率
Petrol is a volatile substance.
汽油是挥发性物质。

Title: The Democratic presidential field already looks crowded

paperStatistics.title: The Democratic presidential field already looks crowded
paperStatistics.desc: Amy Klobuchar becomes the 15th declared candidate in a wide-open primary race
